Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amendment -- HRC Amend., Ord. No. 19-650 - PC
Race.SummaryText: Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Home Rule Charter and Plan of Government (the "Home Rule Charter") for the Parish of Washington, State of Louisiana, be amended and restated, in its entirety, pursuant to Article VI, Section 5 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana and Article VII, Section 7-03 of the Home Rule Charter, as further described in Exhibit B of Ordinance No. 19-650 of the Washington Parish Council?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Bogalusa Prop. No. 1 of 3 -- 2.73 Mills Continuation - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Bogalusa Proposition No. 1 of 3
(Municipal Services)
(Millage Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bogalusa, State of Louisiana (the "City"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, continue to levy and collect a special ad valorem tax of two and seventy-three hundredths (2.73) mills, on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $188,041 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2020 and ending with the year 2029, inclusive, for the purpose of providing municipal services and for the maintenance and operation of municipal service departments, including the acquisition of necessary equipment therefor and the payment of salaries of the personnel of said departments, said tax to represent a 0.02 mill increase over the 2.71 mill tax authorized to be levied through the year 2019 pursuant to an election held on October 17, 2009, such increase having been effective beginning in 2016 due to reappraisal?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Bogalusa Prop. No. 2 of 3 -- 7.84 Mills Continuation - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Bogalusa Proposition No. 2 of 3 
(Retirement & Pension Benefits)
(Millage Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bogalusa, State of Louisiana (the "City"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, continue to levy and collect a special ad valorem tax of seven and eighty-four hundredths (7.84) mills, on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $540,014 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2020 and ending with the year 2029, inclusive, for the purpose of paying the costs of providing retirement and pension benefits for current and former Police Department, Fire Department and general city employees and personnel, said tax to represent a 0.05 mill increase over the 7.79 mill tax authorized to be levied through the year 2019 pursuant to an election held on October 17, 2009, such increase having been effective beginning in 2016 due to reappraisal?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Bogalusa Prop. No. 3 of 3 -- 4.02 Mills Continuation - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Bogalusa Proposition No. 3 of 3
(Parks, Recreation & Public Buildings)
(Millage Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bogalusa, State of Louisiana (the "City"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, continue to levy and collect a special ad valorem tax of four and two hundredths (4.02) mills, on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $276,895 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2020 and ending with the year 2029, inclusive, to be allocated 50% for acquiring, constructing, improving, operating and maintaining parks and recreation facilities and programs, and 50% to pay for acquiring, constructing, improving, operating and maintaining public buildings owned by the City, including the Senior Citizens' Center, and operating programs in such public buildings, said tax to represent a 0.02 mill increase over the 4.00 mill tax authorized to be levied through the year 2019 pursuant to an election held on October 17, 2009, such increase having been effective beginning in 2016 due to reappraisal?
